title: Chinese Government provides million grant for Phase1 of Zimpeto National Stadium Technical Cooperation Project (Linked to Project ID #57490)
description: In 2012, the Chinese Government and the Government of Mozambique signed a grant agreement for Phase 1 of the Zimpeto National Stadium Technical Cooperation Project. The purpose of this project was to maintain and rehabilitate Zimpeto National Stadium, which was constructed between 2008 and 2011 with an RMB 500 million interest-free loan from the Chinese Government (see Project ID#1206). This project was completed, but its precise date of completion is unknown. The phase 2 of the project is captured in #57490.
staff_comments: The Portuguese project title is assistência técnica ao Estádio Nacional de Zimpeto. The Chinese project title is 国家体育场技术合作.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Government provides million grant for Phase1 of Zimpeto National Stadium Technical Cooperation Project (Linked to Project ID #57490)

# Description
In 2012, the Chinese Government and the Government of Mozambique signed a grant agreement for Phase 1 of the Zimpeto National Stadium Technical Cooperation Project. The purpose of this project was to maintain and rehabilitate Zimpeto National Stadium, which was constructed between 2008 and 2011 with an RMB 500 million interest-free loan from the Chinese Government (see Project ID#1206). This project was completed, but its precise date of completion is unknown. The phase 2 of the project is captured in #57490.
justification: Project focuses on stadium maintenance and rehabilitation, which is unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Maintenance and rehabilitation of Zimpeto National Stadium, social infrastructure focus

title: China Trust Fund provides $300,000 USD for the Strengthening institutional capacity of African and Asian countries for the enforcement of environmental legislation through South-South Cooperation Project
description: On 14 December 2012, China’s Ministry of Environmental Protection (China MEP) and the United Nations Environment Program (UNEP) signed a framework agreement on strategic cooperation. This agreement involved China MEP committing $2 million annually to the China Trust Fund which focuses on environmental protection in African, ASEAN, and Central Asian countries.  According to a 2017 Final Report from UNEP, $300,000 USD from the China Trust Fund was allocated to the Strengthening institutional capacity of African and Asian countries for the enforcement of environmental legislation through South-South Cooperation Project (T1-P6) (p. 61). This project took place in China as well as unspecified countries from Africa, ASEAN, and Central Asia. It began in April 2013 and ended in December 2014. The purpose of this project was to strengthen institutions and implement laws related to environmental protection.
combined_text:
# Sector
GENERAL ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION

# Title
China Trust Fund provides $300,000 USD for the Strengthening institutional capacity of African and Asian countries for the enforcement of environmental legislation through South-South Cooperation Project

# Description
On 14 December 2012, China’s Ministry of Environmental Protection (China MEP) and the United Nations Environment Program (UNEP) signed a framework agreement on strategic cooperation. This agreement involved China MEP committing $2 million annually to the China Trust Fund which focuses on environmental protection in African, ASEAN, and Central Asian countries.  According to a 2017 Final Report from UNEP, $300,000 USD from the China Trust Fund was allocated to the Strengthening institutional capacity of African and Asian countries for the enforcement of environmental legislation through South-South Cooperation Project (T1-P6) (p. 61). This project took place in China as well as unspecified countries from Africa, ASEAN, and Central Asia. It began in April 2013 and ended in December 2014. The purpose of this project was to strengthen institutions and implement laws related to environmental protection.
justification: Project focuses on capacity building and institutional strengthening rather than direct environmental impact or energy transition
evidence: Strengthening institutional capacity for environmental legislation enforcement, South-South cooperation focus

title: China Trust Fund provides $300,000 grant for the Capacity-Building for Environmentally Sound Management (ESM) of PBDEs and their waste in selected Asia-Pacific Countries Project
description: On December 14, 2012, China’s Ministry of Environmental Protection (China MEP) and the United Nations Environment Program (UNEP) signed a framework agreement on strategic cooperation. This agreement involved China MEP committing $2 million annually to the China Trust Fund which focuses on environmental protection in African, ASEAN, and Central Asian countries.  According to a 2017 Final Report from UNEP, $300,000 USD from the China Trust Fund was allocated towards the Capacity-Building for Environmentally Sound Management (ESM) of PBDEs and their waste in selected Asia-Pacific Countries Project (T2-P3) (p. 65). This project took place in China, Cambodia, Laos, Mongolia, Pakistan, and Sri Lanka.

title: China Trust Fund provides $400,000 USD grant for the Enhancing South-South Cooperation: Building the Capacity of Developing Countries to Promote Green Economies Project
description: On 14 December 2012, China’s Ministry of Environmental Protection (China MEP) and the United Nations Environment Program (UNEP) signed a framework agreement on strategic cooperation. title: China Trust Fund provides a $300,000 USD grant for the 2013 Global South-South Development (GSSD) Expo

According to a 2017 Final Report from UNEP, $300,000 USD from China Trust Fund was allocated towards the the 2013 Global South-South Development (GSSD) Expo (T1-P3) (p. 4). title: Chinese Government provides grant for Container Inspection Equipment Project
description: In 2012, the Chinese Government provided a grant to the Government of Myanmar for a Container Inspection Equipment Project. The purpose of the project was to provide container inspection equipment to improve its commodity inspection capacity and customs clearance ability. The value and details of this equipment donation are unknown.
staff_comments: The Government of Myanmar was not the only beneficiary of the grant.
combined_text:
# Sector
TRADE POLICIES AND REGULATIONS

# Title
Chinese Government provides grant for Container Inspection Equipment Project

# Description
In 2012, the Chinese Government provided a grant to the Government of Myanmar for a Container Inspection Equipment Project. The purpose of the project was to provide container inspection equipment to improve its commodity inspection capacity and customs clearance ability. The value and details of this equipment donation are unknown.
justification: Project focuses on trade infrastructure improvement without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Container inspection equipment for commodity inspection and customs clearance

title: China grants Myanmar 40 million yuan for Mekong River Security Cooperation Project
description: In 2012, China committed 40 million yuan for the Security Cooperation Project for the Mekong River. The two countries signed an agreement under the Economic and Technical Cooperation. Start and end dates are as claimed by original source.
staff_comments: Project details and year are unclear. A second source could not be found.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
China grants Myanmar 40 million yuan for Mekong River Security Cooperation Project

# Description
In 2012, China committed 40 million yuan for the Security Cooperation Project for the Mekong River. The two countries signed an agreement under the Economic and Technical Cooperation. Start and end dates are as claimed by original source.
justification: Project focuses on security cooperation and does not have clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Security Cooperation Project for the Mekong River, funded under Economic and Technical Cooperation

title: Chinese Government provides USD $6.35 million grant to build home for the elderly in Kachin State
description: According to the Mohinga Aid Information Management System (AIMS), the Chinese Government provided a USD $6.35 million grant in 2012 to the Government of Myanmar’s Ministry of Social Welfare, Relief and Resettlement to build a home for the elderly in Kachin State. This project was reportedly completed with 100% of the grant's commitment being disbursed, but its precise implementation start and end dates are unknown.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Government provides USD $6.35 million grant to build home for the elderly in Kachin State

# Description
According to the Mohinga Aid Information Management System (AIMS), the Chinese Government provided a USD $6.35 million grant in 2012 to the Government of Myanmar’s Ministry of Social Welfare, Relief and Resettlement to build a home for the elderly in Kachin State. This project was reportedly completed with 100% of the grant's commitment being disbursed, but its precise implementation start and end dates are unknown.
justification: Project is a social welfare initiative with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Construction of home for the elderly, classified as social infrastructure
